keyword: how many calories in a large baked potato
title: How Many Calories in a Large Baked Potato?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a large baked potato, including carbs, fiber, protein, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories in a Large Baked Potato?
assumptions: Russet potato, ~300 g with skin, baked plain without oil, butter, or toppings; includes skin for fiber.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by potato variety, size, baking method, and added ingredients. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A large baked potato provides ~278 kcal, mostly from carbs, with 7 g protein and 6.6 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a large baked potato with skin?
faqs.a: About 278 kcal for a plain 300 g baked russet potato with skin.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a large baked potato?
faqs.a: Around 63 g total carbs, including 6.6 g fiber and 3 g sugars.

faqs.q: Is a baked potato high in protein?
faqs.a: No, only ~7 g protein per large potato; it's mostly carbs.

faqs.q: How does baking affect potato calories?
faqs.a: Baking retains nutrients and calories similar to raw, but avoids added fats from frying.

faqs.q: What if the potato is smaller or larger?
faqs.a: Medium (~173 g) has ~161 kcal; extra-large (~400 g) ~370 kcal. Scale by weight.
